Detailed Description

Base class for meshes that have a list of vertices.

Member Function Documentation

void DzVertexMesh::activateVertexGroup ( const QString &  name  )  [slot]

Activates a vertex group, creating it if it does not exist yet. All vertices added after this call will be added to the given group. To stop adding vertices to the group, you must call deactivateVertexGroup(). More than one vertex group can be active at a time.

void DzVertexMesh::addToVertexGroup ( const QString &  name  )  [inline, slot]

Adds all selected vertices to the given group. Fails if the group does not exist.

int DzVertexMesh::addVertex ( const DzVec3 &  pnt  )  [slot]

Adds a new vertex to the vertex array. Methods return the array index at which the vertex was added.

int DzVertexMesh::addVertex ( float  x,
float  y,
float  z 
) [slot]

Adds a new vertex to the vertex array. Methods return the array index at which the vertex was added.

void DzVertexMesh::addVerticesFromMesh ( const DzVertexMesh *  mesh  )  [slot]

Adds all the vertices from the given mesh to this mesh.

void DzVertexMesh::beginEdit ( bool  enableUndo = true  )  [virtual]

Starts an edit operation on this object. If enableUndo is true (the default) then operations performed on the mesh after this call will be undoable. The user must call finishEdit() or cancelEdit() before calling beginEdit() again.

Implements DzGeometry.

void DzVertexMesh::cancelEdit (  )  [virtual]

Cancels the edit operation on this object, resetting all data back to the state it was in before the beginEdit() call.

Implements DzGeometry.

void DzVertexMesh::clearAll (  )  [virtual]

Clears all data from this shape.

void DzVertexMesh::clearVertexBuffer (  )  [protected]

Clears the vertex buffer object. This method must only be called when there is an active OpenGL context!

bool DzVertexMesh::copyFrom ( DzVertexMesh *  mesh,
bool  shareVerts = false,
bool  shareFacets = true 
) [virtual]
Parameters:
mesh The mesh to make this a copy of.
shareVerts If true, the vertex list will be shared between the given mesh and this mesh, if false, the vertex list will be a deep copy.
shareFacets If true, the facet set will be shared between the given mesh and this mesh, if false, the facet set will be a deep copy.
Returns:
A copy of the geometry that is modifiable.

Implements DzGeometry.

bool DzVertexMesh::createVertexGroup ( const QString &  name  )  [inline, slot]

Creates a new vertex group from the set of currently selected vertices. Returns false if there were no vertices selected and the group was not created.

void DzVertexMesh::incrementMeshVersion (  )  const

Increments the mesh version. This is automatically called by copyFrom and finish edit. If changes are made to the mesh values outside of these functions, it is the user's responsibility to call this function.

bool DzVertexMesh::isVertexSelected ( int  which  )  const [slot]
Returns:
true if the vertex at the given index is selected.

) [virtual]

Reimplemented from DzStorable.

void DzVertexMesh::prepareVertexBuffer (  )  [protected]

Creates an empty vertex buffer if vertex buffer is not created yet. It may be needed to do such reservation as vertex buffer is a shared resource, so before any client gets access to it we may want to be sure that the client won't get a NULL pointer.

This method must only be called when there is an active OpenGL context!

DzError DzVertexMesh::preSizeVertexArray ( int  numVerts  )  [slot]

Pre-sizes the array of vertices in this mesh. This function should only be called between calls to beginEdit() and finishEdit(). This allocates the memory needed to store the given number of vertices, but unlike setVertexArray() it does not change the number of vertices in the mesh - this is intended to presize the vertices array before using the addVertex() function. This should only be used when you know exactly how many vertices are going to be in the final list, or can approximate very accurately as any unused slots will be wasted.

void DzVertexMesh::removeVertices ( const DzTSortedArray< int > &  vertIndices  )  [slot]

Removes the given vertices

DzPnt3 * DzVertexMesh::setVertexArray ( int  numVerts  )  [slot]

Resizes the vertex array to numVerts items and returns a pointer to the array - this can be used for fast mesh copying when converting from another kind of shape type, etc.

void DzVertexMesh::shareVertList ( DzVertexMesh *  mesh  )  const [protected]

Vertex lists are stored as shared objects - this call will allow this mesh to share its vertex list with the given mesh.

Emitted when the topology of the geometry has changed.

void DzVertexMesh::transform ( const DzMatrix3 &  matrix  )  [virtual]

Transform this geometry through the transformation matrix. For multiple operations (i.e. translating and rotating, or rotating, scaling and translating) this method is the most efficient. For individual operations, you should use the translate(), rotate() or scale() methods.

Parameters:
matrix The matrix that the geometry should transform itself through.

Implements DzGeometry.

void DzVertexMesh::translate ( const DzVec3 &  vec  )  [virtual]

Translate this geometry by the given vector

Parameters:
vec The vector that the geometry should translate itself by.

Implements DzGeometry.

void DzVertexMesh::updateVertexBufferObject ( const DzTBlockArray< DzVertNTPair > *  pairsVNTAdditional  )  [protected]

Updates vertex buffer object of the mesh. This method must only be called when there is an active OpenGL context!

Parameters:
pairsVNTAdditional The array of pairs <vertex index>=""> - < <normal index>=""> - <uv texture="" coordinate="" index>=""> >. As pairsNT it is a triple that fully describes a drawn point, but instead of i as vertex index the first element is used. This is used to store additional points to support discontinuous normals and uvs. May be NULL if there are no additional points.
DzVertexMap * DzVertexMesh::vertexMapFromImage ( const QImage &  img,
DzMap::MapType  type = DzMap::FLOAT_MAP 
) const [virtual]

Default Implementation - returns a map of the right size with all values zeroed.

Implements DzGeometry.

void DzVertexMesh::writeData ( DzOutFile *  file  )  const [virtual]

Derived classes override this method to write their data to file. This method is only called as needed and may not be called for each file save.

Reimplemented from DzStorable.
